comments.author: jotadeaa@yahoo.com.ar
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

Just loaded a page with some .js files linked


Actual results:

An error is reported WITHIN the HTTP headers of the response to the request of the external .ja file:

Error: missing ; before statement
Source file: http://.../jjv2/scripts/lib/jquery.min.js
Line: 457, Column: 9
Source code: HTTP/1.1 200 OK


Expected results:

No JavaScript error should be reported
comments.creator: jotadeaa@yahoo.com.ar

comments.text: Can you give the URL of that page?
comments.raw_text: Can you give the URL of that page?

comments.author: jotadeaa@yahoo.com.ar
comments.text:
(In reply to :aceman from comment #1)
> Can you give the URL of that page?

It happens in any URL. If I dump the cache and refresh the pages, some times it "fixes", some times it doesn't. Somne times I have to refresh several times to get rid of the error.
I think is an error from the JavaScript interpreter when it reads the files from the cache.
comments.creator: jotadeaa@yahoo.com.ar
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to :aceman from comment #1)
> Can you give the URL of that page?

It happens in any URL. If I dump the cache and refresh the pages, some times it "fixes", some times it doesn't. Somne times I have to refresh several times to get rid of the error.
I think is an error from the JavaScript interpreter when it reads the files from the cache.

comments.author: jotadeaa@yahoo.com.ar
comments.text:
(In reply to :aceman from comment #3)
> So where do you see the error? Is it in the Firefox Web console?

The extract I posted within the bug description (also copied below) was taken from Firefox error console. As you'll see, the error is reported for the HTTP header!! (Source code: HTTP/1.1 200 OK).
I want to clarify that I'm from Argentina, and my FF is in Spanish, so I'm doing my best to get me understood.

Error: missing ; before statement
Source file: http://.../jjv2/scripts/lib/jquery.min.js
Line: 457, Column: 9
Source code: HTTP/1.1 200 OK

comments.creator: jotadeaa@yahoo.com.ar

comments.text:
OK, so the buggy message is the second one in the Error console. It point to line 3 in jquery.layout.js, but claims that line is "Content-Encoding: gzip". Interesting.

The problem is I do not get that error on that page (http://trirand.com/blog/jqgrid/jqgrid.html). Do you get the error every time you visit that URL? Do you have any extensions? Try the page again in Firefox Safe mode (Help->Restart with addons disabled).
comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.raw_text:
OK, so the buggy message is the second one in the Error console. It point to line 3 in jquery.layout.js, but claims that line is "Content-Encoding: gzip". Interesting.

The problem is I do not get that error on that page (http://trirand.com/blog/jqgrid/jqgrid.html). Do you get the error every time you visit that URL? Do you have any extensions? Try the page again in Firefox Safe mode (Help->Restart with addons disabled).
